actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Census and Population.
Committee on Post Office and Civil Service discharged.
Mr. Sawyer asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Senate Committee on Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Passed Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: Designating September 21, 1990, as "National POW/MIA Recognition Day", and recognizing the National League of Families POW/MIA flag.

summary.text: Designates September 21, 1990, as National POW/MIA Recognition Day. Recognizes the National League of Families POW/MIA flag as the official symbol of the United States' commitment to resolving the fates of Americans still prisoner or missing in action in Southeast Asia.

titles.title: Designating September 21, 1990, as "National POW/MIA Recognition Day", and recognizing the National League of Families POW/MIA flag.
